intro: Cryptothladia kokonorica, commonly known as the Tibetan cryptothladia, is a rare alpine plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often compound leaves. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. It has small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
